numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The graph represents the likelihood of admission to an elite school.
2. The graph compares students that have the same test scores.
3. The students have different legacy statuses.
4. Throughout the graph, a legacy student has a higher chance of admission than a non-legacy student.
5. This is true for rich students and for poor students.
6. The richer a legacy student is, the higher the admission boost is.
7. A student in the top 0.1% has 7 times the chance of admission.
8. I wonder why students do not complain about unfair admissions to elite schools.
9. I wonder how much money a rich legacy parent must donate to a school.
10. I wonder if such donations influence admission decisions.
11. I wonder how much test scores affect admissions.
12. I am a senior in my community.
13. Students in my community apply to colleges.
14. Students in my community face competition for admission.
15. A rich non-legacy student has a lower chance of admission to an elite school than a rich legacy student.
16. Some elite schools prefer poor diverse students.
17. Some elite schools prefer rich legacy students.
18. A rich legacy student can donate money to a school.
19. The headline is: Is College Rigged.
